poem:
**Eclipse of the Ordinary**

Under the neon gleam,
the shadow softens tones.
Mystery's fleeting form;
hurry it whispers, 
as echoes of digital night,
pierce the cathedral air.
They gather, faces aglow,
a star-maker's gospel sung;
eternity, in seconds,
bends to mortal want.

— RS Thomas
